page.title: 07RESIDENTIAL AREA - MIREHOUSE
page.content: The dominant feature of this square is the residential area of Mirehouse East.Here the estates are mostly council owned,and built around the same time as those an Mirehouse West.The estates have a large junior and infants school(Valley School) which serves as a community centre,and two churches St.Andrews C of E(1956) and St.Benedicts RC(1962).A small RC infants school also exists(St.Gregory's) and a small number of shops serve the area.All of Mirehouse lies within a valley south of Whitehaven.The main railway runs through the estate.Another feature is Mirehouse pond owned by the Coal Board,recently cleared and stocked with coarse fish,now run by an angling club.
